alert.note: Alert for Northern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:33PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield and central Dutchess Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pleasant Valley, or near Poughkeepsie, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, Hyde Park, Pleasant Valley, Amenia, Kent, Sharon, Millbrook, Millerton, Fairview, Stanfordville, Cornwall Bridge, Dover Plains, Red Oaks Mill, Staatsburg, Warren, Smithfield, Salt Point, Norrie Heights, Lithgow and Hoxie Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
